name: Portfolio Website
description: Why! Its the website you're currently on!
description_long:
This website was made to more properly show the different projects I worked on. I realized that my original method of just giving people a Github profile without a Profile ReadMe was not the best way to handle job applications. But this website was a lot of fun to design and I am happy with the way it turned out. I took a lot of inspiration from DaniDipps portfolio but still did my best to add my own little twists on the design. The website was designed using Vue Components as a base and then dynamically built through reading a set few Json files to allow for quick editing and additions to the portfolio.
The website was then placed onto a dedicated server into a Kubernetes based Docker Environment to keep it running constantly, even between updates!
I had also made use of Githubs CICD platform to automatically build and upload the website to the server

name: SneakyCharacterManager
description: A Character Management plugin for the Lords of Minecraft RP Server.
description_long:
SneakyCharacterManager was designed for the Lords of Minecraft 2 server created by Team SneakyMouse.
The goal was to create a custom plugin that would give players the ability to create custom characters that they could play while roleplaying. This plugin was our solution to this goal.
We designed the plugin to allow players to create multiple difference characters each with different skins and names. These characters could all be selected using the internal character selection menu. When changing characters, the players inventory and location would be automatically saved and loaded based on which character they were playing as.
The plugin was also built to make use of BungeeCord. By default all characters created on 1 server could be used on all other servers on the network with the plugin installed. This was very important because with Lords of Minecraft we had 2 linked servers, one where players could build houses and chat with other community members, and another where players would work together in a team to defend their castle.
The plugin also made use of Mineskin to allow players to save any skin they want. Along with custom skins the plugin also supported chaning players nametags. Due to limits within Minecraft this was handled by creating a text display mounted on the player with their new nickname.
The git repo for this project is located here

name: SneakyVaults
description: A player vault plugin designed for the SneakyMouse LoM Server.
description_long:
SneakyVaults was designed for the Lords of Minecraft 2 server created by Team SneakyMouse.
The goal was to create a custom plugin that would give players the ability to create a 'vault' which they can access anywhere at anytime with the use of a command. As well, the team wanted to have a method of creating template vaults that players could discover while adveturing around the map. As such, this plugin contains the ability to create template vaults, open those vaults for players, and finally keep those template vaults as being per-player persistant allowing for multiple players to claim the same vaults without being able to reset the vault each time they claim.
The git repo for this project is located here

name: LogifyLang
description: A language compiler built using ANTLR V4!
description_long:
LogifyLang was created as a university project. We had spent the semester learning how to create parsing logic using ANTLR along with linking that parsing logic to backend design to allow the execution of programs. For our final project we had to fully create a language with simple aggregate features such as Sum, Sort, Reverse, and Average. As well, the language had to support standard langauge features such as conditionals, functions, and data types. Myself and my team ad decided to take a javascript approch with dynamic data types and optional semi colons.
The git repo for this project is located here

name: MagicSpells for DvZ
description: I assisted in adding features to the MagicSpells plugin for an event called Dwarves vs Zombies
description_long:
In this project I assisted another developer Momo in creating new and interesting features for the MagicSpells minecraft Plugin. This mainly consisted of creating Packet Code to allow for more advanced content like Player Clones or Player Nicknames. There are a few videos in this list.
The first showcasing the player clones shows how I had set up tracking for the clones to follow a Block Display. This allowed the team to move the player clones without needing to keep track of their exact location. This also opened the ability of using the Bukkit API to move the clones instead of Packets
The second video showcases the ability for players to change their display name. This feature changes the players GameProfile on the server side meaning there is no need to update it in the event a player disconnects as the server will take care of it. This also means the Player List and Commands all interact with the displayed users name, not their original, although the original is still an option.
The third video shows an Animated PasteSpell. Although I did not build the original animation, I had setup the ability for the Spell to undo a schematic using the animation. As well I discovered an error with large schematics causing Stack Overflows and implemented a fix to allow the builds to complete.

name: A Server Network Project
description: An attempt at creating a custom built multi-server network for Minecraft.
description_long:
I had looked at servers like Mineplex or Hypixel, and decided I wanted to attempt to develop a similar design. My main goal of this project was learning how MySQL worked and the systems around linking data between servers.
The planned design was a link between a Hardcore server (based on a newer design of my previous plugin) a Survival Server (similar systems to the Hardcore just unlimited lives) and my ReCreation of MinecraftClassic. It was a lot of fun learning how to handle MySQL and working with Linux to set up all the servers.

name: A Re-Creation of DvZ
description: A Re-Creation of Dwarves vs Zombies (Made before the Original returned)
description_long:
This project was created with the goal of returning to an old version of Dwarves vs Zombies. It was based on a version of the Mini-Game created back in 2012 using the MagicSpells plugin. The Re-Creation was developed from scratch and went through 3 different iterations.

The first was based 100% in MagicSpells. This version was 100% true to the original, but the game was very laggy and difficult to add new content to.

Thus the second version was generally split half and half between a custom plugin and MagicSpells. This version was a lot of fun to play but was still missing the expandability that I knew was possible.

The final revision was built from the ground up using a custom Spigot Plugin for Minecraft 1.12.2. This version of the game ran for around 1 year before the project was abandoned due to lack of interest from the community.

On average the event would get 20-30 members each game. Games were run once a week and streamed on Twitch.

name: Hardcore Plugin
description: A Custom plugin made for a Hardcore server designed for a handful of friends
description_long: This project was designed for a twist on normal Hardcore/Survival Minecraft. I had created it with the goal of both giving players a limited number of lives, which would re-charge after 1 day if all were lost, and also giving a Skill Shop to players. This project was the first major system I had created in Minecraft so it was designed very simply but it was loads of fun to play with the community it had. There were around 10-20 consistant players on the server when it was active, it was eventually shut down due to loss of interest. The plugin made use of a Points System where players could gain points by completing Achievements in game. Points were awarded based on the difficulty of the achievement. They could then be spent on Skill Upgrades in a skill shop containing flight, auto smelting, spell, regeneration, and many other perks. As well these points could be used to buy more lives if the player ever got too low. In-Case the player had Skill Points but lost all their lives I had created a Discord Bot which Linked to the server. This lead me to creating a Key System to allow for a link between discord & minecraft accounts.
